ai-sn2:26.1.3_0: “Sir, is it possible to know or see or reach the end of the world by traveling to a place where there’s no being born, growing old, dying, passing away, or being reborn?”
ai-sn2:26.1.4_0: “Reverend, I say it’s not possible to know or see or reach the end of the world by traveling to a place where there’s no being born, growing old, dying, passing away, or being reborn.”
ai-sn2:26.2.1_0: He said, “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing!
ai-sn2:26.2.2_0: how well said this was by Master Gotama.
ai-sn2:26.2.3_0: ‘Reverend, I say it’s not possible to know or see or reach the end of the world by traveling to a place where there’s no being born, growing old, dying, passing away, or being reborn.’
ai-sn2:26.3.1_0: Once upon a time, I was a hermit called Rohitassa, son of Bhoja. I was a sky-walker with psychic power.
ai-sn2:26.3.2_0: I was as fast as a light,
ai-sn2:26.3.2_1: Imagine how easily a well-trained expert archer with a strong bow would shoot a light arrow across the shadow of a palm tree.
ai-sn2:26.3.3_0: I had such strayed to me.
ai-sn2:26.3.5_0: ‘I’ll go to the world, and reach the end of the world.’
ai-sn2:26.3.6_0: Having such speed and stride, I traveled for my whole lifespan of a hundred years—pausing only to eat and drink, go to the toilet, and sleep to dispel weariness—and I passed away along the way, never reaching the end of the world.
ai-sn2:26.4.2_0: how well said this was by Master Gotama.
ai-sn2:26.4.3_0: ‘Reverend, I say it’s not possible to know or see or reach the end of the world by traveling to a place where there’s no being born, growing old, dying, passing away, or being reborn.’”
ai-sn2:26.5.1_0: “But Reverend, I also say there’s no making an end of suffering without reaching the end of the world.
ai-sn2:26.5.2_0: For it is in this fathom-long carcass with its perception and mind that I describe the world, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
ai-sn2:26.6.1_0: We shouldn’t go to the almsbowl
ai-sn2:26.6.3_0: But he does not speak of the world,
ai-sn2:26.7.1_0: For the wise one who knows the world,
ai-sn2:26.7.2_0: who has completed the spiritual journey—
ai-sn2:26.7.3_0: Knowing the end of the world,
ai-sn2:26.7.4_0: does not hope for this world or the next.”
ai-sn2:27.1.1_0: Standing to one side, the god Nanda recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-sn2:27.2.1_0: “The time period is time for those night;
ai-sn2:27.2.4_0: you should do good deeds that bring happiness.”
ai-sn2:27.3.1_0: “The time period is time for those night;
ai-sn2:27.3.4_0: one looking for peace would drop the world’s bait.”
ai-sn2:28.1.1_0: Standing to one side, the god Nandivisāla addressed the Buddha in verse:
ai-sn2:28.2.3_0: and it’s born from a bog. Great hero,
ai-sn2:28.2.4_0: How am I supposed to live like this?”
ai-sn2:28.3.3_0: and plucked out craving, root and all,
ai-sn2:28.3.4_0: that she will be like this.”
ai-sn2:29.1.2_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-sn2:29.1.2_2: Sitting to one side, the Buddha said to Ānanda:
ai-sn2:29.2.1_0: “Sir, who on earth would not like Venerable Sāriputta unless they’re a fool, a hater, delusional, or mentally deranged?
ai-sn2:29.2.2_0: And he too repeated all the terms of praise of Sāriputta, adding,
ai-sn2:29.2.18_0: Who on earth would not like Venerable Sāriputta unless they’re a fool, a hater, delusional, or mentally deranged?”
ai-sn2:29.3.1_0: and the Buddha said, “That’s how it is, Ānanda.
ai-sn2:29.3.2_0: Who on earth would not like Venerable Sāriputta unless they’re a fool, a hater, delusional, or mentally deranged?”
ai-sn2:29.3.3_0: And he too repeated all the terms of praise of Sāriputta, adding,
ai-sn2:29.3.13_0: and he doesn’t mix closely with Sāriputta.
ai-sn2:29.3.19_0: Who on earth would not like Venerable Sāriputta unless they’re a fool, a hater, delusional, or mentally deranged?”
ai-sn2:29.4.1_0: While this praise of Sāriputta was being spoken, the god Susīma approached the Buddha, escorted by a large assembly of gods.
ai-sn2:29.4.1_2: He bowed, stood to one side, and said to him:
ai-sn2:29.5.1_0: “That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!
ai-sn2:29.5.2_0: Who on earth would not like Venerable Sāriputta unless they’re a fool, a hater, delusional, or mentally deranged?”
ai-sn2:29.5.3_0: And he too repeated all the terms of praise of Sāriputta, adding,
ai-sn2:29.5.4_0: Sir, widespread wisdom, widespread wisdom, laughing wisdom, swift wisdom, sharp wisdom, and penetrating wisdom. He’s endowed with great wisdom. He’s content, secluded, aloof, and energetic.
ai-sn2:29.5.5_0: Who on earth would not like Venerable Sāriputta unless they’re a fool, a hater, delusional, or mentally deranged?”
ai-sn2:29.6.1_0: “For I too, sir, whenever I go to an assembly of gods, frequently hear the same terms of praise.”
ai-sn2:29.6.3_0: For he has great wisdom, widespread wisdom, laughing wisdom, swift wisdom, sharp wisdom, and penetrating wisdom. He’s content with wisdom, Venerable Sāriputta, has few desires, content, secluded, aloof, and energetic; Venerable Sāriputta is content. Then he’s secluded, he says this, and Venerable Sāriputta.’
ai-sn2:29.6.4_0: Who on earth would not like Venerable Sāriputta unless they’re a fool, a hater, delusional, or mentally deranged?”
ai-sn2:29.7.1_0: While this praise of Sāriputta was being spoken, the gods of Susīma’s assembly—uplifted and overjoyed, full of rapture and happiness—generated a rainbow of bright colors.
ai-sn2:29.8.1_0: Suppose there was a beryl gem that was naturally beautiful, eight-faceted, well-worked. When placed on a cream rug it would shine and glow and radiate.
ai-sn2:29.8.2_0: In the same way, while this praise of Sāriputta was being spoken, the gods of Susīma’s assembly—uplifted and overjoyed, full of rapture and happiness—generated a rainbow of bright colors.
ai-sn2:29.9.1_0: Suppose there was a pendant of river gold, fashioned by an expert smith, well wrought in the forge. When placed on a cream rug it would shine and glow and radiate.
ai-sn2:29.9.2_0: In the same way, while this praise of Sāriputta was being spoken, the gods of Susīma’s assembly—uplifted and overjoyed, full of rapture and happiness—generated a rainbow of bright colors.
ai-sn2:29.10.1_0: Suppose that after the rainy season the sky was clear and cloudless. At the crack of dawn, the Morning Star shines and glows and radiates.
ai-sn2:29.10.2_0: In the same way, while this praise of Sāriputta was being spoken, the gods of Susīma’s assembly—uplifted and overjoyed, full of rapture and happiness—generated a rainbow of bright colors.
ai-sn2:29.11.1_0: Suppose that after the rainy season the sky was clear and cloudless. As the sun rises, it would dispel all the darkness from the sky as it shines and glows and radiates.
ai-sn2:29.11.2_0: In the same way, while this praise of Sāriputta was being spoken, the gods of Susīma’s assembly—uplifted and overjoyed, full of rapture and happiness—generated a rainbow of bright colors.
ai-sn2:29.12.1_0: Then the god Susīma recited this verse about Venerable Sāriputta in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-sn2:29.13.4_0: the hermit shines in the Teacher’s praise!”
ai-sn2:29.14.1_0: Then the Buddha replied to Susīma with this verse about Venerable Sāriputta:
ai-sn2:29.15.4_0: developed and well-tamed, he bides his time.”
ai-sn2:30.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-sn2:30.1.3_0: Then, late at night, several glorious gods lit up the entire Bamboo Grove. They were Asama, Sahalī, Niṅka, Ākoṭaka, Vetambarī, and Māṇavagāmiya, and all of them were disciples of various sectarian teachers. They went up to the Buddha,
ai-sn2:30.1.3_1: They approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.
ai-sn2:30.1.4_0: Standing to one side, the god Asama recited this verse about Pūraṇa Kassapa in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-sn2:30.2.5_0: What he taught should truly be trusted,
ai-sn2:30.2.6_0: he’s worthy of esteem as Teacher.”
ai-sn2:30.3.1_0: Then the god Sahalī recited this verse about Makkhali Gosala in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-sn2:30.4.1_0: “Through mortification in disgust of sin he became well restrained.
ai-sn2:30.4.2_0: He gave up arguing with people.
ai-sn2:30.4.3_0: Refraining from false speech, he spoke the truth.
ai-sn2:30.4.4_0: Surely such a man does no wrong!”
ai-sn2:30.5.1_0: Then the god Ākoṭaka recited this verse about Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-sn2:30.6.2_0: well restrained in the four controls;
ai-sn2:30.6.3_0: explaining what is seen and heard:
ai-sn2:30.6.4_0: For what must be no longer doing?”
ai-sn2:30.7.1_0: Then the god Ākoṭaka recited this verse about various sectarian teachers in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-sn2:30.8.2_0: as well as this Makkhali and Pūraṇa:
ai-sn2:30.8.4_0: surely they weren’t far from truly good men!”
ai-sn2:30.9.1_0: Then the god Vetambarī replied to the god Ākoṭaka in verse:
ai-sn2:30.10.3_0: A naked liar with suspicious conduct,
ai-sn2:30.10.4_0: though they teach a community, doesn’t resemble the good.”
ai-sn2:30.11.1_0: Then Māra the Wicked recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-sn2:30.12.1_0: “Those dedicated to mortification in disgust of sin,
ai-sn2:30.12.4_0: they rejoice in the heavenly realm.
ai-sn2:30.12.5_0: Indeed, those mortals give correct instructions
ai-sn2:30.13.1_0: Then the Buddha, knowing that this was Māra the Wicked, replied to him in verse:
ai-sn2:30.14.1_0: “Whatever forms there are in this world or the world beyond,
ai-sn2:30.14.2_0: and those of shining beauty in the sky,
ai-sn2:30.14.3_0: all of these you praise, Namuci,
ai-sn2:30.14.4_0: like bait tossed out for catching fish.”
ai-sn2:30.15.1_0: Then the god Māṇavagāmiya recited this verse about the Buddha in his presence:
ai-sn2:30.16.2_0: Vipula’s said to be the best.
ai-sn2:30.16.3_0: Seta is the best of the Himalayan peaks,
ai-sn2:30.16.4_0: and the sun, of travelers in space.
ai-sn2:30.17.1_0: The ocean is the best of seas,
ai-sn2:30.17.2_0: and the moon, of lights that shine at night.
ai-sn2:30.17.3_0: But in all the world with its gods,
ai-sn2:30.17.4_0: is such a one who is declared.”
ai-sn2:30.17.5_0: The third sub-chapter on various sects is finished.
ai-sn2:30.18.4_0: and they find ten thousand coins.
ai-sn2:30.18.5_0: The Linked Discourses on Gods are complete.
